author: National Bureau
text:
The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs (CCEA) on Wednesday approved fixation of Nutrient Based Subsidy (NBS) rates for Phosphatic and Potassic (P&K) fertilizers for 2016-17 on account of the decreasing trend in international prices of finished fertilizers and raw materials, an official statement said.

“At the same level of consumption of P&K fertilizers (about 310.44 lakh tonnes) during 2016-17 as in 2015-16, the total subsidy implication on P&K fertilizers for 2016-17 at proposed rates works out to be about Rs. 21,274 crore,” the statement said.

The CCEA approved Rs. 15.854 per kg for Nitrogen (N), Rs. 13.241 per kg for phosphorous (P), Rs. 15.470 per kg potash (P) and Rs. 2.044 per kg for sulphur (S).

“Under this policy, the subsidy on P&K fertilizers is announced by the government annually for each nutrient i.e. Nitrogen (N), Phosphorous (P), Potash (K) and Sulphur (S) on per kg basis which is converted into subsidy per tonne depending upon the nutrient content in each grade of the fertilizers,” it said.
title: Govt. fixes P&K fertilizer subsidy at Rs.21,274 cr.
